messages.content: What is the purpose of comfyui-anime-seg?
comfyui-anime-seg is a custom node for ComfyUI that performs anime character segmentation based on the hf space https://huggingface.co/spaces/skytnt/anime-remove-background.
From which repository was comfyui-anime-seg forked?
comfyui-anime-seg was forked from the abg-comfyui repository located at https://github.com/kwaroran/abg-comfyui.git.

To install comfyui-anime-seg, first clone the repository to the custom_nodes directory using the command 'git clone https://github.com/LyazS/comfyui-anime-seg.git', and then install the dependencies from requirements.txt in the ComfyUI environment using 'pip install -r requirements.txt'.
Where should I place the 'isnetis.onnx' model file?
The 'isnetis.onnx' model file should be downloaded from https://huggingface.co/skytnt/anime-seg/tree/main and placed in the 'custom_nodes/comfyui-anime-seg/model' directory.
How do I use comfyui-anime-seg in ComfyUI?
To use comfyui-anime-seg in ComfyUI, create a 'mask/Anime Character Seg' node and connect the image input. The node will segment the anime character and output the masks.
Which model is used for anime character segmentation in comfyui-anime-seg?
comfyui-anime-seg uses the 'isnetis.onnx' model for anime character segmentation.
What is the output of the 'mask/Anime Character Seg' node in ComfyUI?
The 'mask/Anime Character Seg' node in ComfyUI outputs the segmented masks of the anime characters.
